$4,441 a monthPart-timeATTENTION ALASKA RESIDENTS!
**This individual position is EXEMPT from the hiring restriction. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply.**

The Department of Fish and Game, Division of Sport Fish – RTS is recruiting for a permanent, fulltime Geographic Information System (GIS) Analyst II (PCN 11-7076) working in Anchorage.

Do you like to show your work?
Are you task orientated?
Are you spatially orientated?
Are you comfortable working on your own?
Are you comfortable working in a geospatial environment?
Do you want to go places without leaving the office?
Do you enjoy collaborating with others to find solutions to complex and multi-faceted mapping issues?

If you answered "yes" then this may be the job for you!

The position has primary responsibility for designing and producing numerous high quality digital (geodatabases, data, project applications) and hard copy Geographic Information System (GIS) products (maps, atlases), requiring a working knowledge of a variety of graphic and mapping software applications. Creates custom ArcView projects and trains staff in use. This requires proficiency in the use of ArcGIS desktop and server along with associated extensions. In addition, the incumbent is also responsible for maintaining and making annual revisions to the master statewide Anadromous Waters Catalog (AWC) dataset. There are typically hundreds of nominations to the AWC each year and editing, error checking, completion of final maps, geodatabase, and metadata revisions follows a tight schedule that includes Department and public review.

Key responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:
Produces shape files and final digital map files for download from the department website and for creation of data layers by species. Resulting shape files are also used to create species specific data layers which are also made available for download from the department website.
Recalculates legal descriptions and spatial coordinates for each stream, lake and polygon area and performs multiple error checks on the geodatabases prior to Catalog production.
Reviews and edits draft maps and spatial data layers and other data to ensure accuracy and completeness including data depiction, registration and presentation.
Creates digital and hardcopy maps and other products that are effective and efficient in portraying graphic data.
Documents GIS data by writing metadata following established standards, which may include Federal Geographic Data Committee compliant metadata.
Works independently or collaboratively with department staff and project leaders to identify data requirements for project needs and designs geodatabase structure for efficient editing and analysis.
Conducts yearly edits (i.e., additions, deletions and changes) to water bodies and creates maps using custom ArcMap project.
Edits and maintains AWC geodatabases and customized ArcMap projects for editing and map creation.
Performs research to acquire the most current and detailed spatial data for analysis.
Edits data layers that have errors in spatial relationships between features or when there are inconsistent or missing data in tabular fields.
Develops automated methods for processing of repetitive tasks using existing tools or new programming.
Creates annotation layers for use in final map products and internet mapping applications.
Uses Model-builder or Python to create tools or write programs to facilitate common or repetitive GIS operations.
Addresses questions from department staff on GIS software, and GIS-related internet resources.
Trains professional and technical staff on the use of GIS (examples: teaching biologists about annotation for map creation).
Provides data to department staff, other state and federal agencies and the public (example: maps for review comments on special areas management plans).

The ideal candidate will possess some or all of the following desired strengths (All of these traits must be documented in your cover letter and applicant profile. If you do not have experience with one or more of the traits listed below, simply say so):
Knowledge of and proficiency using and manipulating ARCGIS software products.
Ability to present graphic information in an easily understandable format such as maps and posters.
Experience creating electronic products (maps and data) primarily in ArcGIS for varied projects including the depiction of fish and wildlife distribution, river navigability, land status, and subsistence use areas.
Experience creating digital map layers from hard copy sources such as mylar maps or on-screen from georectified aerial photo images, digital raster graphics and digital orthophotos or by scanning hard copy maps and vectorizing the arcs.
Experience georectifying aerial photos (i.e., digital alignment of a satellite or aerial image with a map of the same area) using software such as ArcGIS and ERDAS Imagine when necessary.
Experience researching and mapping land ownership for specific areas using state and federal plats and borough tax records, acquires land patents or other recorded documents to substantiate mapped information and authenticate reservation of public access trails.
Experience reviewing and editing draft maps and spatial data layers and other data to ensure accuracy and completeness including data depiction, registration and presentation.
Experience planning and developing projects by assessing user`s need, and delivering data, maps, KML (Google EarthTMfiles) or GPS files as requested.
Experience documenting GIS data layers by writing metadata following established standards, which often includes Federal Geographic Data Committee compliant metadata (i.e., national standard for metadata).
Experience extracting meaningful data out of existing resources utilizing the Spatial Analyst functions of ArcGIS to aggregate and filter data to better answer questions of the staff.
Experience using map services such as GIS online, Web Mapping Service (WMS), or Web Features Service (WFS).
Experience training others in the use of GPS handheld units and GPS software for field research by demonstrating basic functionality to ensure that data is collected accurately and efficiently.
Ability to recalculate points, polylines and polygon from legal descriptions using metes and bounds.
Knowledge of and proficiency in use of Microsoft Office products such as Word, Excel and Access.
Ability to work independently or as part of a team.

Special Requirements:
The incumbent must possess and maintain a valid Alaska driver's license. The position requires that the incumbent is capable of processing and utilizing firearms in the field. Prior to entering the field, the successful applicant will be required to obtain First Aid and CPR certifications and participate in ADF&G Wildlife and Firearm safety classes.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

One year of professional experience equivalent to GIS Analyst I with the State of Alaska.

AND

An associate's degree from an accredited college that includes either a GIS related concentration, a GIS certificate, or 9 semester hours (12 quarter hours) of GIS-related course work;

SUBSTITUTION:

Two years of paraprofessional experience working in data collection, cartography, web-site development, GIS operations, or a related field will substitute for the required associate's degree.

SUBSTITUTION:

A bachelor's degree from an accredited college that includes either a GIS-related major or minor, a GIS certificate, or 18 semester hours (24 quarter hours) of GIS-related coursework will substitute for the required experience and associate's degree.

About LanzaTech
LanzaTech is turning our global carbon crisis into a feedstock opportunity with the potential to displace 30% of crude oil use today and reduce global CO2 emissions by 10%. LanzaTech’s carbon recycling technology is like retrofitting a brewery onto an emission source like a steel mill, but instead of using sugars and yeast to make beer, bacteria convert pollution to products! Imagine a day when you can power a plane by recycled carbon emissions, when your yoga pants or sneakers started life as pollution from a steel mill. This future is possible using LanzaTech technology with the first 2 commercial units converting steel mill waste gases to fuels being built; in China with Shougang and in Belgium with the world’s largest steel maker, ArcelorMittal. LanzaTech has an additional 3 commercial projects in the pipeline, in India, South Africa and California. LanzaTech has already produced synthetic jet fuel from recycled carbon emissions and has a partnership with Virgin Atlantic.
In 2017, LanzaTech was recognized as the #1 Hottest company in the Advanced Bioeconomy by Biofuels Digest, the world’s most widely-read bioeconomy daily. The company was also inaugurated into the Cleantech100 Hall of Fame, having been listed in the top 100 cleantech companies over the last 7 years. In 2016, the company won the Young Global Leader Award for Circular Economy at the World Economic Forum, LanzaTech was also the top biofuels company in the 2016 CNBC Disruptor 50 Companies list. In 2015, LanzaTech was awarded the U.S. EPA Presidential Green Chemistry Award for Greener Synthetic Pathways. The company’s accomplishments were recognized through a number of prestigious awards in 2014, including the Guardian Sustainable Business Innovation Award for Carbon and Energy Management, Breakthrough Innovation Award at the Platts Global Metals Awards, and the Technical Development Award from the World Petroleum Council. In 2013, the company was named a World Economic Forum Technology Pioneer.
About the role
LanzaTech has developed extensive metabolic modeling capability around our novel gas fermentation platform. This modeling capability is used to guide scientific, engineering and business decisions.
You will use your expert knowledge of microbial metabolism to computationally design, develop and refine new microbial strains that specialize in making chemicals from pollution. You will participate in the design-build-test feedback loop with scientists and engineers across the company to refine these strain designs and contribute to the ongoing development and refinement of our models.
Key duties
Integrate metabolomic, genomic, proteomic and transcriptomic data sets to solve deep biological problems
Contribute to ongoing development and refinement of genome annotations, metabolic knowledgebases and metabolic models
Design in silico experiments for biological discovery, computational strain design, process optimization and the prediction of cellular phenotypes.
Carry out in silico experiments using the latest metabolic modeling technology
Clearly document work and methods by integrating code and narrative text in Jupyter notebooks
Communicate your findings, insights and conclusions to other scientific teams
Present summary of results to group in weekly meetings
Education & Experience
REQUIRED
PhD in computational biology, quantitative biology, bioinformatics, computational systems biology or equivalent
Strong knowledge of microbial biochemistry
Significant exposure to prokaryotic biology with emphasis on metabolism, ideally to a gas fermenting acetogen
Deep knowledge of the principles behind genome-scale modeling, flux balance analysis and associated techniques
Expert user of genome-scale modeling tools such as cobrapy, cameo, Escher, OptFlux, COBRA Toolbox
Intermediate Python knowledge or expert in another programming language
Team player balanced with strong individual initiative
NICE TO HAVE
Industry experience highly desirable
Exposure to microbial fermentation highly desirable
Experience with Gurobi, CPLEX, TOMLAB
Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Travis CI, Git
Experience designing interactive data visualizations using Bokeh, R Shiny or Tableau
Experience with ME and GEM-Pro genome-scale models, kinetic models and whole-cell models
Experience in synthetic biology
This position is open to candidates authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any employer. LanzaTech is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status.

$4,954 - $6,499 a monthDescription


The Department of Fish and Wildlife has some of the most talented people in the natural resource field. We celebrate and value diversity, appreciating that a workforce composed of those from different backgrounds and experiences creates an inclusive environment, strengthens positive relationships with the local community, and brings new perspectives and approaches to fulfilling the agency's mission.

The Washington Department of Fish and Wildlife (WDFW) is dedicated to preserving, protecting and perpetuating fish, wildlife and ecosystems, while providing sustainable recreational and commercial opportunities dependent on viable fish and wildlife populations. Each day, WDFW employees facilitate fishing, hunting and wildlife viewing opportunities for millions of residents and visitors. WDFW's employees–field and laboratory biologists, geneticists, research scientists, hatchery professionals, policy experts, fully commissioned law enforcement officers, land stewards, lab technicians, property acquisition specialists, customer service representatives and others work throughout the state. WDFW employees protect and restore critical habitat, strive to facilitate species recovery when necessary, and manage hundreds of fish and wildlife species. WDFW employees maintain nearly a million acres of public wildlife lands. They interpret, apply and enforce state and federal laws and collaborate with stakeholders to protect fish and wildlife resources. Find out more about us and the important work we are a part of at www.wdfw.wa.gov.

Communications Consultant 5
Permanent/Full-Time
This recruitment is to fill one (1) full-time permanent Communication Consultant 5 position in the WDFW Public Affairs and Community Relations unit. The position is based at the agency's Region 1 office in Spokane Valley, Spokane County, Washington.

JOB SUMMARY
The WDFW Public Affairs and Community Relations unit communicates information on department activities and initiatives and conducts community outreach to establish and enhance partnerships with constituents across the state. The unit produces and distributes all department news releases, responds to inquiries from the media and others, and issues a monthly roundup of recreational opportunities. The staff also develops content for and manages WDFW's website and social media platforms.

Communications consultants work with executives and other staff to develop and implement strategic communication plans for a variety of complex and high-profile natural resources issues. They develop numerous materials to communicate and interact with the public, including news releases and content for social media and the department's website. In addition, Communications consultants help coordinate WDFW's participation in hunting and fishing shows, community events, and other outreach activities aimed at reaching diverse audiences throughout the state.

This recruitment is open until the position is filled. The hiring authority reserves the right to make a hiring decision at any time. It is in the applicant's best interest to submit materials as soon as possible.
First application review will take place on August 30, 2018
Duties
Media relations and social media: The media and public are very interested in the department's activities. The department receives hundreds of media inquiries annually from state, national and international news organizations. Communications consultants are expected to:
Respond to inquiries from the news media and other organizations, and serve as a spokesperson for the department.
Coordinate interviews, and plan and organize events such as news conferences, public meetings, and project briefings.
Coach and prepare executives and subject matter experts for interviews with print, digital and broadcast journalists.
Monitor social media platforms, and develop engaging social media posts and promotions covering a variety of topics, including non-hunting and non-fishing recreational opportunities such as wildlife viewing, and recreation-oriented community events.
Community relations: The department's communication and community relations activities are closely related, so communication consultants are expected to:
Write and edit materials for external audiences, such as presentations and handouts.
Represent the department at public meetings and community events.
Help coordinate events, such as sports shows and public meetings, by engaging with the department's various programs.
Strategic communication: The Public Affairs and Community Relations unit has many responsibilities, all of which require staff members to communicate effectively verbally and in writing, and to plan and execute short- and long-term communications and outreach projects. The person in this position will be expected to:
Research and write a variety of communications materials, including news releases, web and social media content, recreation reports, brochures, fact sheets, editorials and issue papers.
Advise executive managers and staff throughout the department on communications goals and objectives; media and stakeholder relations; and public engagement.
Develop and implement strategic communications and public information plans and activities for department programs.
Project coordination: Many of the work unit's projects call for ongoing coordination and oversight, requiring the person in this position to:
Participate in work groups to develop practical, cost-effective project plans that ensure timely completion of communications and outreach priorities.
Work with other team members to solve problems or resolve unexpected challenges.
Evaluate the results of completed projects in collaboration with other staff.
Qualifications

At least four (4) years of professional experience in the news media, public information or public relations.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Demonstrated proficiency in project management.
Experience working independently and interacting with the public.
Proficiency in the use of standard office equipment, including a computer and office telephone system.
Proficiency in all Microsoft Office programs, in particular Outlook, Word, PowerPoint and Excel.
Understanding of social media, in particular Facebook, Twitter, YouTube and Instagram.
Preferred/Desired Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in public relations, communications, journalism, marketing, public administration, or a related field.
Familiarity with natural resources, economic development, conservation and outdoor recreation organizations and issues in Washington.
Proficient in photography and videography.
Spanish language capabilities would be welcome.
Experience working with Washington state agencies and local governments.
Supplemental Information

POSITION SUMMARY
REGENXBIO is searching for a translational research scientist to design and conduct appropriate preclinical studies to support the development of gene therapy clinical candidates. The role will have a strong focus on development of human iPSCs to various lineages in line with portfolio requirements and the incumbent should have a strong background in Stem Cell Biology. The successful candidate will also provide scientific input and support the investigation of biomarkers measuring drug action and disease progression/regression.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead pharmacologist in the Translational Research lab supporting the REGENXBIO portfolio.
Responsible for the development of in-house human iPSC disease models and expand role to become a scientific leader for gene therapy pharmacology.
Contribute to the designof IND enabling pharmacology studies to support the development of a clinical candidate to initial clinical studies.
Perform in vitro experiments to address key mechanistic and pharmacological scientific questions relating to AAV biology that is relevant to the disease target.
Design, complete experimental studies, carry out data analyses and interpretation, record results, and report findings to the team.
Interact with a team of scientists and engage in both target exploration and driving established projects in our portfolio.
Present, discuss and review data within R&ED and with other stakeholders.
Contribute to pharmacology sections in INDs/CTAs/BLAs etc.
Work cross-functionally across the organization, including Regulatory, CMC, Clinical, Quality Assurance, Bioanalytical Sciences and other groups.
Present/attend scientific conferences.

SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES REQUIRED
Ph.D. in Biomedical Sciences; Master’s degree with strong experience may be considered.
At least 3 years post-doctoral experience in pharmacological related sciences in academia or industry setting.
Proficiency with human pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs) and their differentiation into functional tissues as evidenced by publications.
Proficiency with standard assays (e.g. qPCR, flow cytometry, imaging, luminescence-/fluorescence-based cellular readouts).
Ability to work independently and take responsibility for the progression of small projects.
Experience with gene therapy, in particular working with AAVs.
Demonstrated ability to analyze and resolve problems.
Must possess excellent oral and written communication skills.
TECHNICAL SKILLS
Desire to constantly review, consider and develop emerging cell biology technologies.
Experience in the maintenance, expansion, transfection and differentiation of human iPSCs to various lineages as well as methods for gene targeting/editing in iPSCs.
Knowledge of molecular biology techniques such as DNA, RNA, and protein isolation; qRT-PCR, Western blot, ELISA, Immunohistochemistry.
Experience working with animal models of disease
Experience of working on several projects simultaneously and the ability to work independently as well part of a team.
Suggest and implement changes to experimental procedures and data analyses to increase quality of output and minimize time.
WORKING CONDITIONS AND/OR PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Normal working conditions
MANAGER/SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
None

Position Summary
Known for its scientific and operational excellence, Regeneron is a leading science-based biopharmaceutical company that discovers, invents, develops, manufactures, and commercializes medicines for the treatment of serious medical conditions. Regeneron commercializes medicines for eye diseases, high LDL-cholesterol, atopic dermatitis and a rare inflammatory condition and has product candidates in development in other areas of high unmet medical need, including rheumatoid arthritis, asthma, pain, cancer and infectious diseases.

Summary
We are looking for an experienced PhD level Scientist to head a new small group devoted to the synthesis and testing of oligonucleotides, such as antisense oligonucleotides and siRNAs, for RNA therapeutic applications. The scientist will be responsible for managing the operation of an automated oligonucleotide synthesis facility and an analytical team responsible for purification and quality assessment of the oligonucleotide products. The scientist will also supervise a team of molecular and cell biologists who will perform biochemical and cell culture experiments to assess the function of the synthetic oligonucleotides.

Responsibilities

Operate and maintain oligonucleotide synthesis machinery

Manage and develop a small team of nucleic acid scientists and RA’s

Supervise cellular assay development and optimization

Assist in the development of new technology for the synthesis and application of oligonucleotides and other nucleic acid reagents

Perform advanced data analysis as well as trouble shooting under minimal supervision.

Keep up-to-date and well-organized records of order requests, syntheses, and product quality

Communicate and report study findings at meetings

Work cooperatively with an advisory team to optimize screening strategies and develop functional assays

Contribute to group goals and objectives with new ideas and creative approaches
Requirements

This position requires a PhD, at least two years of postdoctoral experience, and at least five additional years of relevant experience.

A strong knowledge of nucleic acid biochemistry

Experience with chemical synthesis of nucleic acids highly desirable

A high level of skill in cellular and molecular biology and biochemistry experimental techniques

Experience with the design and execution of mammalian cell-based assays

Ability to work independently with limited supervision but also be a productive and cooperative member of a diverse research team

Ability to manage multiple projects

Prior experience managing people is desirable

Strong written and oral communication skills
Level will be commensurate with experience

This is an opportunity to join our select team that is already leading the way in the Pharmaceutical/Biotech industry. Apply today and learn more about Regeneron’s unwavering commitment to combining good science & good business.

job_description: Lodo Therapeutics discovers and develops breakthrough medicines for some of the greatest challenges in human health: drug-resistant bacterial infections and cancer. Lodo Therapeutics identifies and produces pharmaceutically active secondary metabolites directly from the biosynthetic blueprints encoded in the genomic DNA sequences of soil bacteria. Metagenomic data analysis—not experimental serendipity—drives our discovery of new therapeutics. $2,414 - $3,420 a monthDescription




The Department of Fish and Wildlife has some of the most talented people in the natural resource field. We celebrate and value diversity, appreciating that a workforce composed of those from different backgrounds and experiences creates an inclusive environment, strengthens positive relationships with the local community, and brings new perspectives and approaches to fulfilling the agency's mission.

The Washington Department of Fish and Wildlife (WDFW) is dedicated to preserving, protecting and perpetuating fish, wildlife and ecosystems, while providing sustainable recreational and commercial opportunities dependent on viable fish and wildlife populations. Each day, WDFW employees facilitate fishing, hunting and wildlife viewing opportunities for millions of residents and visitors. WDFW's employees–field and laboratory biologists, geneticists, research scientists, hatchery professionals, policy experts, fully commissioned law enforcement officers, land stewards, lab technicians, property acquisition specialists, customer service representatives and others work throughout the state. WDFW employees protect and restore critical habitat, strive to facilitate species recovery when necessary, and manage hundreds of fish and wildlife species. WDFW employees maintain nearly a million acres of public wildlife lands. They interpret, apply and enforce state and federal laws and collaborate with stakeholders to protect fish and wildlife resources. Find out more about us and the important work we are a part of at www.wdfw.wa.gov

There is currently a permanent Fish Hatchery Specialist 2 In-training at the Whitehorse Hatchery. The duty station is located at 30722 – 379th Ave, Arlington, WA. 98223.

Duties
Fish Hatchery Specialist 1 (FHS1): Performs a variety of technical and scientific fish culture duties, performs hatchery related maintenance, and participates in an agency supervised fish culture training program.

Fish Culture; Feeds fish their calculated daily ration; monitors fish behavior, health, egg and fish production; calculates and administers drugs as prescribed; identifies, sorts, and samples species for spawning and adult distribution; cleans ponds and raceways, troughs, and incubator systems, identifies marked adults and collects tags/marks for bio sampling and records data; collects fish tissue and fluid samples; performs fish inventories, splits, marking trailer inventories, weight samples, releases and plants fish.

Recordkeeping and Reporting; Enters data into forms and spreadsheets (e.g. fish mortality, feed sheets, feed inventory, and chemical usage); accurately fills out agency forms such as fish transfer tickets, hatchery invoice tickets, etc. Submits complete and accurate forms required. Assist in developing in-house forms as required.

Operation and Maintenance of Facility; Monitors water flow and quality parameters; takes water samples and readings (e.g. dissolved gases, suspended settleable solids, and other parameters as required) maintains proper water flow and rearing environments; responds to alarms; monitors and maintains facility support systems; actively identifies safety hazards and takes action or recommends remedies as appropriate.

Operation and Maintenance of Equipment; Organizes and maintains hatchery tools, equipment, and grounds; identifies and communicates safety concerns (management to staff and staff to management), uses tools and equipment properly and safely.

Public Contact and Communications; Responds to/answers questions from visitors or outside entities in a polite professional manner. Conducts organized tours; identifies the best way to respond with difficult-to-answer questions or when information is not readily obtainable.

Working Conditions
This position works at a full cycle fish rearing facility dividing its time between an outdoor all weather, at times strenuous work environment, to an office setting. Work week is Monday to Sunday and typically work is 5-8 hour days per week, depending on the time of year; includes days, nights, weekends and holidays as needed. Normally does not exceed a 40 hours per week unless emergency conditions exist. The ability to lift 50 lbs. This position requires a valid driver's license. This position is off-station and standby has been assigned to this position.

Note:
All applicants considering applying for this position should understand and consider that standby is a requirement for all positions in the Fish Hatchery Specialist series. Management may determine it is necessary to assign it in order to accomplish the goals and objectives of the agency and as necessary to protect the resources of the agency and if assigned, it will be a requirement of the position.

Union
This position is in the bargaining unit represented by the Washington Association of Fish & Wildlife Hatchery Professionals and is subject to the terms of the Collective Bargaining Agreement between the State of Washington, Department of Fish & Wildlife, and the Washington Association of Fish Hatchery Professionals (WAFHP).
Qualifications
One year of experience as a Fish Hatchery Specialist 1 and successful completion of agency supervised training program. OR Associate's degree in fisheries technology or closely allied field. OR Three years of education towards a Bachelor's degree in fisheries or closely allied field. OR Successful completion of a fish culture program from a vocational school. OR Three years of experience performing a variety of fish culture duties in a hatchery will substitute for the required education. Preferred work experience in a hatchery setting.

Knowledge and Abilities Desired:

Basic computer skills, familiarity with Microsoft Outlook and Excel software.
Basic fish culture techniques; rearing procedures
Water dynamics ( e.g. flows, flow patterns, availability, temperature, etc)
Calibration of specialized instruments (e.g. scales, Dissolved Oxygen meters)
Basic math; calculate and understand quantities and proportions
Ability to lift 50 lbs, work out of doors in all weather conditions and perform strenuous physical activities.
Safe and proper use and maintenance of tools and equipment.
Communicate effectively with the public

Three professional references (personal references do not count as professional)

Administrative Associate, ChEM-H

Division/School: Vice Provost and Dean of Research
Job Code: 4103
Grade: F
Exemption: Non-exempt

Note: Not all unique aspects of the job are covered by this job description

Stanford ChEM-H is a new interdisciplinary institute focused on connecting Chemistry, Engineering, and Medicine for Human Health. The institute was founded as a joint venture of the Schools of Medicine, Engineering, and Humanities and Sciences. The proximity of world-class biologists, chemists, engineers, and clinicians at Stanford presents unique opportunity to study human biology at a molecular level, to translate this knowledge into groundbreaking products and services that promote healthy living, and to educate a new cadre of “physician-scientist-engineers” who will lead a rapidly evolving industry.

Stanford ChEM-H is seeking an Administrative Associate (Administrative Associate 3) to support institute leadership, programs, and operations. Candidates should be self-starters, comfortable with autonomy, and embrace opportunities to tackle new problems and challenges as part of a dynamic team in a start-up-like environment within the University.

JOB PURPOSE:
The Administrative Associate reports directly to the Associate Director of Stanford ChEM-H. This position provides administrative and operational support to the overall operation of Stanford ChEM-H working with limited supervision. May be responsible for leading other administrative staff or subordinates.

CORE DUTIES*:

Act on behalf of the supervisor, department manager, or chair in regards to establishing priorities and identifying and resolving problems that are administrative in nature. Triage requests for ChEM-H Director and Associate Director time. Schedule meetings involving multiple faculty from units across campus as well as meetings with external partners and visitors.
Oversee and/or perform duties associated with scheduling, organizing, and operating complex conferences, seminars, and events, including arranging with vendors for services, overseeing the production and distribution of materials, administering logistics, and managing events within budget.
Compose and draft documents and correspondence for presentations, course handouts, grants, conferences, seminars, fundraising, and fellowship and grant opportunity advertisements; perform substantial editing and fact checking. Create, maintain, modify, and/or ensure accuracy of content in various unit documents, displays, reports, brochures, social media, and/or websites.
Plan and schedule calendar(s) with limited consultation, resolve calendaring conflicts, and arrange travel in compliance with unit, university, and sponsor policies.
Coordinate ChEM-H-led faculty searches. Gather information for search initiations and search waivers. Post job announcements, and distribute other outreach materials to attract candidates. Collect applications, and provide administrative support to search and review committees. Coordinate compilation of search report materials with partner hiring departments. Coordinate all logistical aspects of candidate visits, including arranging transportation and accommodations, scheduling meetings and interviews, and processing reimbursements.
Create complex reports and spreadsheets which may utilize specialized software and systems.
Oversee and/or process a variety of complex financial transactions; produce, monitor, and reconcile budget statements; research, identify, and resolve discrepancies. May assist with capital or special equipment requests and/or vendor selection.
Coordinate and monitor routine maintenance services completion. Plan and coordinate office moves and/or minor renovation projects.
May lead staff or supervise day-to-day work of student and/or temporary workers, including scheduling, assigning, and prioritizing workloads, setting appropriate deadlines, reviewing work for quality and timeliness, and providing performance review input.

Other duties may also be assigned
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
Education & Experience:
High school diploma and four years of administrative experience, or combination of education and relevant experience.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Advanced computer skills and demonstrated experience with office software and email applications.
Demonstrated success in following through and completing projects.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills.
Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and assign work to others.
Ability to take initiative and ownership of projects.
Ability to routinely and independently exercise sound judgment in making decisions.

Certifications and Licenses:

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Experience planning and scheduling calendars with limited consultation.
Knowledge of Stanford administration systems.

Demonstrated ability to use new technologies and/or online tools to support work with minimal formal training.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS*:

Frequently sitting.

Promote Culture of Safety: Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for safety; communicates safety concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned.

About Stanford

Stanford University, located in the heart of California's Silicon Valley, is one of the world's leading teaching and research universities. Since its opening in 1891, Stanford has been dedicated to finding solutions to big challenges and to preparing students for leadership in a complex world.

Supporting that mission is a staff of more than 10,000, which is rooted in a culture of excellence and values innovation, collaboration, and life-long learning. To foster the talents and aspirations of our staff, Stanford offers career development programs, competitive pay that reflects market trends and benefits that increase financial stability and promote healthy, fulfilling lives. An award-winning employer, Stanford offers an exceptional setting for professionals looking to advance their careers.

Our lab seeks an energetic individual to help us drive our research forward. We are cell biologists and biochemists who study how things move around in cells. Movement is often powered by the actin cytoskeleton, so we focus on actin-based processes. We use mammalian culture cells for much of our work, using live-cell microscopy to track dynamics of multiple proteins or organelles simultaneously. We also conduct cell-free biochemical experiments with purified proteins, with the goal of understanding mechanism at a molecular level. An interest in either live-cell microscopy or rigorous biochemistry is strongly desired for this position. The successful applicant would work on their own research project in addition to maintaining the laboratory. We encourage applications from recent college graduates as well as those with post-baccalaureate training who have had substantive exposure in biochemistry, cell or molecular biology.
Position Purpose
To set up and conduct a variety of biochemical and cellular tests and experiments by applying established methods, procedures, and techniques in support of research studies directed at three related goals: a) how mammalian cells control actin polymerization; b) how actin polymerization can be used to drive other processes, such as mitochondrial division; and c) how these processes are altered in cancer cells.
Required Qualifications
Associate’s degree with a major in one of the Biological or Chemical Sciences or the equivalent combination of education and experience.
Some relevant laboratory or science experience.
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree with a major in one of the Biological or Chemical Sciences or the equivalent combination of education and experience.
Competence in several laboratory methods, procedures and techniques as well as the equipment and instruments. Knowledge of microscopy and/or image processing would be helpful.
Ability to work independently with good judgment and good organizational and time management skills.
Willingness to work with/be exposed to hazardous materials such as radioactive materials, infectious materials, and/or hazardous chemicals.
Knowledge of computers and software applications.

The Chan Zuckerberg Biohub is a new, independent research center that will serve as a nexus for collaborations between experts across multiple disciplines—including engineers, computer scientists, biologists and chemists and other innovators—to work together on some of the most pressing scientific questions of today.

Our goal is to accelerate basic science research to help cure, prevent or manage all diseases by the end of the century.

We formed in partnership with Stanford University, University of California, San Francisco and University of California, Berkeley, and are led by renowned scientists Joe Derisi and Stephen Quake.

Our ethos includes commitments to collaboration, scholarly excellence, disruptive innovation, and broadly sharing the tools we develop and our learning with the scientific and technology communities.

The Role
The Single Cell Genomics (SCG) Platform Leader will be central to the mission of the CZ Biohub. S/he will lead the platform with an emphasis on providing single cell sequencing and related technologies to the Biohub and its collaborators. The SCG Platform Leader will have experience managing and implementing large scale sequencing projects and will have a track record in collaborative scientific research and innovation. This person will provide technology vision and leadership in the development and implementation of emerging genomic technologies. The successful candidate will help plan and implement specific strategies to support ambitious projects undertaken by the hub and its collaborators.

Additionally, the SGC Platform Leader will:

Manage, maintain and facilitate access to the Biohub Sequencing Infrastructure.
Help Biohub scientists and their collaborators make effective use of cutting edge genomics technologies on various projects. These projects are expected ultimately to include cellular, patient, and population data at all scales.
Provide access to new and emerging single cell sequencing technologies for both small and large scale projects.
Design, develop and implement scalable workflow processes and operating procedures such that the SCG platform can be effectively utilized by Biohub scientists, CZ Biohub Investigators, and other collaborative faculty.
Participate in collaborative research with institute scientists to design and execute single cell sequencing experiments. Assist the Biohub and its collaborators in making appropriate technology choices in a project-dependent manner.
Collaboratively publish scientific results.
Provide strategic and tactical planning, development, evaluation, and coordination of new equipment acquisitions.
Facilitate communication between scientists, staff, management, vendors, and other technology resources within the organization with regards to genomics, and the opportunities to apply genomic and sequencing technologies broadly.
Able to create an innovative technology vision for the organization by understanding strengths, weaknesses and opportunities.
Sees the “bigger picture” and understands how genomics can best be leveraged through a more coordinated platform.
“Hands on” leader, comfortable working in a fast-paced start-up environment and not hesitating to work at the bench when needed.
Balances urgent and effective action, commitment to excellence and taking initiative to resolve problems; holds internal stakeholders accountable where appropriate.
Capable of executing short-term (tactical) and long-term (strategic) plans.
Defines and translates a vision into actionable plans.
Develops loyalty and commitment in others by articulating an appealing vision for the future, communicating high expectations, developing and mentoring direct reports and setting an example in her or his own behavior.
Able to gain credibility quickly with internal and external constituents.
Able to influence and achieve alignment across a range of opinions and interests.
Strong communication, listening and negotiation skills; able to convey important messages in a clear and compelling manner.
Define Single Cell Genomics experimental procedures that are robust, re-usable as needed, and on occasion scaled to very high throughput.
Implement and communicate requirements (sample handling, data analysis, etc.,) as needed to collaborators.
Identify and improve workflow bottlenecks such that the SCG platform can run experiments and produce data on a continuous basis.

Setting Strategy

Able to create an innovative technology vision for the organization by understanding strengths, weaknesses and opportunities.

Arcadis is seeking an experienced Biologist/Ecologist to join our environmental permitting/ecological services team in Houston, Texas. The position will assist with permit compliance and support numerous client sectors with implementing field activities and preparing permit applications for a variety of capital improvement, maintenance, and remediation projects. Much of the work will focus on the midstream oil and gas environment (i.e., pipelines).

Primary responsibilities include:

Conducting desktop assessments and field surveys (e.g., habitat evaluations and presence/absence surveys) to evaluate potential project impacts to sensitive habitats or special status speciesWorking with the Arcadis and client teams to develop project implementation and permitting strategies to efficiently comply with state and federal laws and regulations (e.g., Endangered Species Acts, Migratory Bird Treaty Act, and Sections 401 and 404 of the Clean Water Act)Preparation of regulatory permit application packages (e.g., US Army Corps of Engineer Clean Water Act Section 404 permit applications, 401 Water Quality Certification applications, and Section 402 NPDES permit applications)Preparation of technical reports such as species surveys, mitigation and monitoring plans, and biological assessmentsMonitoring of mitigation sites (including hydrology and vegetation studies)The role may also include occasional biological field work, such as conducting wetland delineations and functional assessments (e.g., Texas Rapid Assessment Methodology or Hydrogeomorphic Methodology), authoring associated reports, monitoring of mitigation sites, and wildlife surveysPeriodic travel (up to 15 percent of the time)Occasional work in inclement weather (often hot and humid) and over difficult or rough terrain
Additional Information:
Excellent organizational, written, and verbal communications skillsAbility to multi-task and work in fast paced and often changing project environmentTeam oriented, with the ability to work independently when given clear goals and objectives

Bachelor's degree in Biology or related field
Three years of experience in the environmental field
Knowledge of regional permitting and regulatory processes
Required Driving StatementThis position requires a current valid driver’s license and clean driving record.
Preferred Qualifications
Five or more years of consulting experience
Master's degree
Experience with evaluating project compliance with state and federal laws and regulations
Experience with Texas coastal ecology
Experience in the environmental consulting industry

JOB OPENING: DIRECTOR OF LAND STEWARDSHIPOUR MISSION: To Preserve and Care for Greenways and Green Places, and to Connect People to the Land to Inspire a Conservation Ethic, Now and ForeverD&R Greenway Land Trust seeks an enthusiastic and experienced professional to oversee and assist in the stewardship of our preserved lands. D&R Greenway manages 70 fee properties totaling over 2,600 acres, 63 Easements totaling 3,800 acres and over 30 miles of trail. We have established 4 ‘Flagship’ Preserves open to the public. We manage a small, mission-oriented Native Plant Nursery. D&R Greenway is committed to continuing our legacy of land preservation and growing into a strong leader in land stewardship. This position is a direct report to the President & CEO.Located in Princeton, New Jersey in a ca. 1900 renovated barn, D&R Greenway was among the first 10% of land trusts to be accredited in 2012 and was reaccredited in 2017. Land preservation is urgent in New Jersey, predicted to become the first “built-out” state in the country. We are a creative, solutions-oriented land trust preserving land in urban, suburban and rural communities. We will celebrate our 30th anniversary in 2019 having preserved over 300 parcels of conservation lands. Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C., a division of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies is recruiting for an Associate Scientist in Discovery Chemistry, for our site in Spring House, PA.

At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, what matters most is helping people live full and healthy lives. We focus on treating, curing and preventing some of the most devastating and complex diseases of our time. And we pursue the most promising science, wherever it might be found.

Janssen Research & Development, LLC discovers and develops innovative medical solutions to address important unmet medical needs in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases and vaccines, and cardiovascular and metabolic diseases. Please visit http://www.janssenrnd.com/ for more information.

We are Janssen. Our mission drives us. Our patients inspire us. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it.

Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

The newly formed Discovery Chemistry group is committed to the delivery of high quality drug candidates working with all six Janssen Therapeutic Areas (TAs). This mission requires deep scientific expertise in a number of disciplines including chemistry, cellular and molecular pharmacology, enzymology, and screening technologies coupled with an ability to work collaboratively with internal and external partners. Building on a strong legacy of success, we are currently seeking an outstanding individual to join our team as Associate Scientist, Discovery Chemistry. This position will be based at our drug discovery site in Spring House, PA.

We are seeking an experienced BS or MS-level medicinal chemist with excellent organic synthesis expertise to advance small molecule drug discovery programs toward the clinic. In this laboratory-based position, the successful candidate will partner with both internal and external medicinal chemistry teams to generate innovative solutions to synthetic and medicinal chemistry challenges within the context of small molecule drug discovery projects. This person will maintain close interactions with computer assisted design scientists and biologists. Strong people skills and the ability to thrive in a team and goal driven environment are key attributes.

This individual must also excel in communication and have strong interpersonal skills necessary to influence in a collaborative multidisciplinary environment.

Responsibilities of the Associate Scientist include:
Maintaining a high level of productivity in the laboratory setting
Developing and executing clear synthetic strategies towards complex molecules using state-of-the-art synthetic methodologies
Synthesizing drug-like molecules utilizing medicinal chemistry knowledge and an understanding of ADME, pharmacokinetics and optimal physicochemical properties
Collaboratively supporting the advancement of compounds through in vitro and in vivo studies to identify development candidates
Collaboration with structure based design groups to impact rational design of molecules.
Working on novel, testable hypotheses to enable clear decision making
Contributing to scientific strategies and goals within a project team setting
Presenting data and reports on project status at individual and group meetings
Generating data for and serving as co-author on research published in peer reviewed journals, and presenting work at scientific conferences


Qualifications
Bachelors or Masters in synthetic, organic, medicinal chemistry or related chemistry degree is required
A minimum of 4 years of relevant pharmaceutical medicinal chemistry industrial experience is required
Strong track record of achievement in the synthesis of drug candidates, with a deep knowledge of modern synthetic & analytical techniques is required
Proven track record of scientific contributions including peer reviewed publications, patents and presentations is required
Experience with computational chemistry methods and chemo informatics tools is preferred
Independent thinking and the ability to effectively collaborate in a highly matrixed environment
Excellent oral and written communication skills, including preparation of presentations

Founded by Dr. Priscilla Chan and Mark Zuckerberg in 2015, the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative (CZI) is a new kind of philanthropy that's leveraging technology to help solve some of the world's toughest challenges – from eradicating disease, to improving education, to reforming the criminal justice system. Across three core Initiative focus areas of Science, Education and Justice and Opportunity, we're pairing engineering with grantmaking, impact investing, policy work, and movement building, to help build an inclusive, just and healthy future for everyone.

Our Values

We believe we can help build a future for everyone.


We aim to be daring, but humble: We look for bold ideas — regardless of structure and stage — and help them scale by pairing engineers with subject matter experts to build tools that accelerate the pace of social progress.
We want to learn fast, but build for the long-term: We want to iterate fast and help bring new solutions to the table, but we also realize that important breakthroughs often take decades, or even centuries.
Stay close to the real problems: We engage directly in the communities we serve because no one understands our society's challenges like those who live them every day.

Our success is dependent on building teams that include people from different backgrounds and experiences who can challenge each other's assumptions with fresh perspectives. To that end, we look for a diverse pool of applicants including those from historically marginalized groups — women, people with disabilities, people of color, formerly incarcerated people, people who are lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and/or gender nonconforming, first and second generation immigrants, veterans, and people from different socioeconomic backgrounds.

The Opportunity

Our mission is to support science and technology that will help make it possible to cure, prevent, or manage all diseases by the end of the century. Interdisciplinary teams of physicians, biologists, computational scientists, and engineers can expand our understanding of the human body and illness — the very science behind medicine. CZI fosters collaboration between scientists and engineers, develops tools and technologies, and builds support for basic scientific research. Examples of the work CZI Science is supporting include the Human Cell Atlas, a global project to create a complete reference map of all the cells in the human body; and the Chan Zuckerberg Biohub, an independent nonprofit research hub to bring scientists and engineers together from Stanford, UCSF, UC Berkeley, along with the engineering team from CZI.

Our Technology team in Science is seeking an experienced User Experience Researcher to conduct rigorous research on the Infectious Disease Sequencing (IDseq) tool ( https://github.com/chanzuckerberg/idseq-web ), a collaboration between CZI and Dr. Joe DeRisi's lab ( http://derisilab.ucsf.edu/ ). This role will be responsible for designing and conducting rigorous research to answer the highest priority questions, including "full-stack" UX research focusing on foundational, strategic, generative, tactical, and evaluative questions. This role will split time between CZI's Redwood City offices and the Chan Zuckerberg Biohub in San Francisco (Mission Bay).

You will
--------


As a member of CZI's Technology team, you will design and execute rigorous research to better understand the attitudes, behaviors, and needs of scientists, researchers, and individuals relying on scientific data to do their jobs
collaborate with product management, engineering, data science, and design on research that informs the directions and development of product solutions; including stakeholders in the research process is important
design and execute rigorous research that addresses the highest-priority questions in a human-centered way
gather and convey insights in clear, compelling ways that evaluate hypotheses, inspire new ideas, and encourage design iteration
run usability research for new products to inform product iterations and launches
build a library of insights over time for the organization to continually reference
collaborate with cross-functional partners to translate their curiosities into actionable research questions
design and execute mixed-methods studies, using qualitative and quantitative methods where appropriate, to help your teams learn about scientists' and researchers' behaviors and attitudes
partner with cross-functional teammates to identify the largest impact problems to solve through our products
collaborate with product team to generate concepts that address problems faced by scientists and researchers
evaluate low- and high-fidelity concepts
analyze qualitative and quantitative data and convey insights in clear, illustrative ways that help the team learn about the scientific process, inspire product strategy, and encourage design iteration
participate in critique by sharing and receiving constructive feedback
adapt the optimal approach to mixed-methods research based on product goals, timelines, and our fast-growing Technology team
typically spend 1-2 days a week at the Chan Zuckerberg Biohub in Mission Bay (San Francisco) and travel - including internationally - for research purposes
organize research studies and trips that are inclusive of stakeholders
in your first year, you will
embed yourself deeply in their project areas and establish the highest levels of trust with stakeholders
assist the IDseq/Biohub stakeholders in identifying users' workflows, needs, pain points and bottlenecks, and work with the product team to translate those findings into product design/development solutions
collaborate with Biohub stakeholders to identify and prioritize research questions, develop and execute on a research plan to begin addressing them
educate stakeholders about UX research through involving them in the research process
Example projects include:
1) conducting foundational and generative interviews as well as usability research on the the Infectious Disease Sequencing tool (IDseq) to understand where design iterations may be needed.
Recruiting and speaking with a variety of investigators in the infectious disease field (including researchers and outbreak responders, for example) to understand their needs, workflows, data and tooling needs, and whether/how they see themselves using the IDseq platform.
2) collaborating with the Product Manager and Director of Engineering for CZI's partnership with the Biohub as well as Biohub leadership to identify research questions about the partnership, what's working well, what are opportunities for change, etc?

You have
--------


The following skills / abilities:
empathy
expertise in several qualitative and quantitative methods
impeccable communication and collaboration skills
strong prioritization skills
ability to work both independently and collaboratively
desire to learn about new, technical fields
comfort interacting with individuals with highly technical and specialized roles
positive attitude
collaborative
strong and compelling communication
comfort with occasional shifts, pivots, and uncertainty
unwavering commitment to rigorous research
can accurately identify and execute appropriate methods for a given research question
distills stakeholder questions into research questions
strong advocate for users and for research findings
prioritization
curiosity
In your career, you have
successfully designed, executed, analyzed, and reported on multiple mixed-methods UX research projects.
successfully collaborated with stakeholders to help the team make research-informed product decisions, both strategic and tactical.
had to deliver "tough" findings to stakeholders and advocate for potentially unpopular research results.
successfully navigated relationships with stakeholders who may not be familiar with UX research or its value.
not been afraid to be scrappy, learn new areas, and think on their toes.
worked with technical users in the past (ideally with scientists).
worked on projects involving complex data, data visualization, and dashboards.

Founded in 2013 and based in the San Francisco Bay Area, Zymergen is a technology company unlocking the power of biology. We deliver better economics for products made from biology that are used across industries, bring new products to market faster, and develop novel products. Our proprietary platform uses robots and machine learning to engineer microbes faster, more predictably, and to a level of performance previously unattainable. These microbes, and the products they produce, have broad applications across industries such as chemicals and materials, agriculture, and healthcare. For more information visit www.zymergen.com ( http://cts.businesswire.com/ct/CT?id=smartlink&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.zymergen.com%2F&esheet=51436625&newsitemid=20161010006215&lan=en-US&anchor=www.zymergen.com&index=1&md5=eadf9f7cb8a0bdbfa22eb7b2688a7e09 ).

Job Description and Specific Responsibilities

The Synthesis & Formulation Scientist will be joining the applications team as one of its core members and will be responsible for synthesizing resins used as binders in coatings and adhesive formulations. The candidate is expected to translate the performance needs of the formulator into useable resins. The candidate will also assist with formulating adhesives and coatings. This role will lead the design of novel functional polymers and oligomers targeting the expected performance based on customer specifications. The candidate will also collaborate with the applications team, formulators, industry managers, product application engineers, scientists, and biologists, to deliver meaningful products. Expertise in synthesizing amine-functional resins, polyols, epoxies, isocyanates, adhesion promotors, additives, and UV curable resins is helpful.

Immediate responsibilities include:

Maintain an expert level of current and next generation resins for adhesive and coatings technologies.
Experienced synthesizing a broad range of resins for the coatings and adhesives industry.
Familiar with commercially available resins in the industry.
Experienced in different polymerization techniques.
Experienced scaling up resin synthesis.
Experienced with design of experiment software.
Exposure to formulation and the ability to formulate.
Some customer experience is desirable.

The Products team within the company is integral to producing novel products across various industries and application areas. We need members of the team to be laser-focused, thoughtful, analytical, well-organized, energetic, collaborative, and fully engaged in the development of new products. In addition, we need team members to be fully committed to the continuous improvement of the products developed and investigation of the properties that new bio-based molecules can bring to the product line.

Qualifications/Experience


PhD. in Chemistry, Engineering, or Materials Science with at least three years research or industry experience is preferred.

Our facilities are located in the San Francisco Bay Area.

Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service Programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional, philanthropic, religious, spiritual, community, student, social). 0404 Biological Science Technician (Wildlife)

Compiling and summarizing biological data obtained from aerial and ground surveys to determine vegetation type, wildlife and livestock use, and to identify and evaluate habitat management.

Position Summary and Qualifications

Mission or Goal of Unit
VCU Life Sciences promotes transformative learning and integrative scholarship through an interdisciplinary, systems-based approach. Its university-wide matrix structure provides a framework for borderless academics, and promotes collaborative learning opportunities among students, molecular biologists, mathematicians, computational scientists, ecologists, physicians, and artists. The mission of the Center for Biological Data Science (CBDS) is to build an academic community centered on quantitative and computational discovery science and to promote collaborative and reproducible research and education in basic and applied life sciences across VCU. The center develops and supports critical infrastructure and core capabilities at VCU in bioinformatics, genomics, proteomics, and computational systems biology. Center faculty apply data science and informatics principles to research, instructional and other scholarly activities in the life sciences.

Chief purpose of this position in support of above mission or goal
The instructor will provide teaching and service in support of the Bioinformatics undegraduate and graduate degree programs and in support of the mission of CBDS.

Position Responsibilities
Successful candidates for the non-tenure track position will be expected to develop and teach innovative courses in biological informatics and data science; mentor undergraduate and graduate students; and have a commitment to outreach and service both within and beyond the University community.

Required Qualifications
A doctoral degree (Ph.D.) in the biological sciences, data sciences, bioinformatics, or a related field; demonstrated experience in teaching and mentoring students, demonstrated experience working in and fostering a diverse faculty, staff, and student environment or commitment to do so as a faculty member at VCU.

Preferred Qualifications
Demonstrated experience in development and assessment of teaching materials at the undergraduate and graduate levels. Demonstrated ability working with a diverse student population.

The Opportunity- Scientist (Disease Model Systems)

The heart of insitro’s strategy is the development of novel, cutting edge methods in machine learning and high-throughput biology to address key bottlenecks in the drug development pipeline. To accomplish that, we are putting together an incredible team of highly talented biologist, bioengineers, machine learners, and data scientists who want to make a difference to this important problem. You will have expertise in generation of iPSCs and iPSC-based disease models across diverse areas including inflammation, neurological, and metabolic disease. You will be an expert in differentiation of iPSC to multiple lineages and complex co-culture and 3D organoid systems. You will have knowledge of current state of the art genome-editing and high-throughput assay development techniques such as single cell RNA-seq and multielectrode array. You will work in a cross functional team to design new experiments and develop large, innovative disease relevant-biological datasets using cutting edge, high-throughput platforms and assays. You will participate in presenting these results to internal and external stakeholders, and in disseminating your work via scientific publications. We believe that strong teams require diverse skill sets: we like biologists who know how to program, engineers who understand biology, and everything in between. Most importantly, we want motivated and talented candidates who are interested in being part of a unique, cross-disciplinary team.

You will be joining as the founding team of a biotech startup that has long-term stability due to significant funding, yet is very much in formation providing many opportunities for significant impact. You will work closely with a very talented team, learn a broad range of skills, and help shape insitro’s culture, strategic direction, and outcomes. Join us and help make a difference to patients!

About You

PhD in developmental biology, cell biology, genetics, molecular biology, or related fields, or equivalent experience
Deep knowledge and expertise in generation and differentiation of iPSCs to multiple lineages
Experience in developing complex systems such as organoids or co-culture models
Experience in high-throughput assay development
Familiarity with state of the art genome-editing and high-throughput assay development techniques such as single cell RNA-seq and multielectrode array
Demonstrated track record of successful scientific execution and communication
Excellent communication skills, including with people from diverse backgrounds
Requires a high level of creativity and flexibility
Passion for working in a team and making a difference in the world

Nice to Have

2-4 years of practical experience working on iPSC-based disease modeling projects
Experience managing cross-functional project teams

Benefits at insitro

Excellent medical, dental, and vision coverage
Open vacation policy
Team lunches (catered daily)
Commuter benefits
Paid parental leave

About insitro
insitro is an exciting startup company that aims to take a new approach to drug development: one with big data and machine learning at its core. We plan to build on the ground-breaking innovations that have occurred in life sciences to develop large data sets that are designed from the start to allow machine learning to address fundamental bottlenecks in the drug development process. Our goal is to cure more people, sooner, and at a much lower cost.

We are fortunate to have the strong support from the top investors in both biotech and tech: ARCH Ventures, Foresite Capital, A16Z, GV, and Third Rock Ventures. We are building a remarkable team that embodies a new type of culture, one based on a true partnership between scientists, engineers, and data scientists. Together we are working to define the problems, design experiments, analyze the data, and derive the insights that will lead us to new therapeutics. Join us, and help make a difference to patients!

Join a dynamic academic community whose excellence is reflected in its diversity and student success. West Chester University of Pennsylvania's Department of Biology invites applicants for the position of Cell & Molecular Biologist. This is a tenure-track, Assistant Professor position and can begin either January or August 2019 depending on the successful candidate's availability. Actual starting salary is commensurate with experience.

Responsibilities

Teaching: Teaching responsibilities include upper division courses and/or labs in Cell & Molecular Biology, Molecular Genetics, and introductory level biology courses. The candidate may also be required to develop an undergraduate or graduate course in their area of expertise. The teaching load at WCU is 12 student contact hours per week per semester.

Advising: To advise biology majors regarding academic planning and scheduling. Faculty must schedule 5 hours of advising/consultation time each week for students.

Research: To establish an active, externally funded research program involving undergraduate and/or graduate students. Faculty are expected to present results at national meetings and publish in refereed journals.

Service: To contribute to the university community and the department by serving on committees, helping to recruit potential students, and performing other services as needed.

Minimum Qualifications
An earned doctorate in Cell & Molecular Biology or related discipline is required; candidate must be qualified to teach courses and/or labs in Cell & Molecular Biology, Molecular Genetics, and introductory level biology courses.

Finalists must successfully complete the interview process, including a teaching demonstration and a research seminar.

Special Instructions
To apply, upload a cover letter, curriculum vitae, teaching philosophy statement, research statement, and all undergraduate and graduate unofficial university transcripts to the online application system at http://agency.governmentjobs.com/wcupa/default.cfm. In addition, provide email addresses for three references when completing the application. Referees will automatically be sent an email with access to upload their letter of recommendation directly to the applicant tracking system. For any questions, please contact Dr. Jessica Sullivan-Brown at Search-Bio@wcupa.edu.

Review of applications will begin on September 24, 2018 and continue until the position is filled.

General Information

Approximately 14,000 undergraduate and 2,800 graduate students attend West Chester University (WCU), located 25 miles west of Philadelphia in scenic southeastern Pennsylvania. The Department of Biology has 21 full time tenure-track faculty, approximately 750 undergraduate Biology majors in 6 different concentrations, and a Master of Science program (thesis and non-thesis) averaging around 50 graduate students. The department has well-equipped facilities for Cell & Molecular Biology research with shared thermocyclers, gel imaging systems, real-time PCR machines, NanoDrop spectrophotometers, fluorescence plate readers, centrifuges, and ultra-low temperature freezers. Microscopy equipment includes two epifluorescence microscopes (with phase contrast and Nomarski DIC) equipped with color cameras, a laser microdissection microscope, and scanning and transmission electron microscopes. The department also houses a microtechniques laboratory, tissue culture hoods, and CO2 and bacterial incubators. The animal facility contains zebrafish, rats, and mice, and meets standards for NIH accreditation. For additional information, please visit the Department of Biology web page (http://bio.wcupa.edu).

Developing and sustaining a diverse faculty and staff advances WCU's educational mission and strategic Plan for Excellence. West Chester University is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. Women, minorities, veterans, and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

The filling of this position is contingent upon available funding. All offers of employment are subject to and contingent upon satisfactory completion of all pre-employment background and consumer reporting checks.
